oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Capt. Jehu Valentine Chase
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Chase was commander of the USS Minnesota when she struck a German naval mine in September 1918. The ship was saved and he was awarded a Distinguished Service Medal for his splendid seamanship. Graduating from the Naval Academy in 1890, Chase served in the Spanish-American War. After World War I Chase rose to the rank of rear admiral and Commander-in-Chief of the U.S. Fleet. He was buried in Arlington National Cemetery after his death in 1937. He is misidentified on the reverse as "C. B. Chase."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Chase, Jehu Valentine
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
